natural problem:
The function $f(x)$ satisfies
\[f(x) + f \left( \frac{x + 1}{1 - 3x} \right) = x\]for all $x \neq \frac{1}{3}.$  Find $f(2).$
natural solution: Setting $x = 2,$ we get \[f(2) + f \left( -\frac{3}{5} \right) = 2.\]Setting $x = -\frac{3}{5},$ we get \[f \left( -\frac{3}{5} \right) + f \left( \frac{1}{7} \right) = -\frac{3}{5}.\]Setting $x = \frac{1}{7},$ we get

\[f \left( \frac{1}{7} \right) + f(2) = \frac{1}{7}.\]Adding the first and third equations, we get \[2f(2) + f \left( -\frac{3}{5} \right) + f \left( \frac{1}{7} \right) = \frac{15}{7}.\]Then $2f(2) - \frac{3}{5} = \frac{15}{7},$ which means $2f(2) = \frac{96}{35},$ so $f(2) = \boxed{\frac{48}{35}}.$

a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real" and x :: real
assumes h0 : "\<forall>x. x \<noteq> 1/3 \<longrightarrow> f x + f ((x + 1) / (1 - 3 * x)) = x"
shows  "f 2 = 48 / 35"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 The function $f(x)$ satisfies
\[f(x) + f \left( \frac{x + 1}{1 - 3x} \right) = x\]for all $x \neq \frac{1}{3}.$  Find $f(2).$ The final Answer is \frac{48}{35}
 ### Proof
 Setting $x = 2,$ we get \[f(2) + f \left( -\frac{3}{5} \right) = 2.\]Setting $x = -\frac{3}{5},$ we get \[f \left( -\frac{3}{5} \right) + f \left( \frac{1}{7} \right) = -\frac{3}{5}.\]Setting $x = \frac{1}{7},$ we get
 \[f \left( \frac{1}{7} \right) + f(2) = \frac{1}{7}.\]Adding the first and third equations, we get \[2f(2) + f \left( -\frac{3}{5} \right) + f \left( \frac{1}{7} \right) = \frac{15}{7}.\]Then $2f(2) - \frac{3}{5} = \frac{15}{7},$ which means $2f(2) = \frac{96}{35},$ so $f(2) = \boxed{\frac{48}{35}}.$
 *)

theorem
fixes f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real" and x :: real
assumes h0 : "\<forall>x. x \<noteq> 1/3 \<longrightarrow> f x + f ((x + 1) / (1 - 3 * x)) = x"
shows  "f 2 = 48 / 35"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_0.informal problem: Find the value of $f(2)$ if the function $f(x)$ is defined by the equation $f(x) + f\left(\frac{x+1}{1-3x}\right) = x$, for all real numbers $x$ that are not equal to $1/3$. The final answer is $\frac{48}{35}$.

 *)
